In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function in Julia that wraps a string based on a given maximum text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str)
    lines = []
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = word
        else
            line = length(line) > 0 ? line * " " * word : word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

You can use the `wrap_string` function like this:

```julia
long_string = "This is a very long string that we want to wrap around to fit a certain text width"
wrapped_string = wrap_string(long_string, 20)
println(wrapped_string)
```

Output:

```
This is a very
long string that
we want to wrap
around to fit a
certain text width
```
